question:
Currently, which of the above is/are included in basket of reserve currencies under International Monetary Fund?
  1. Euro
  2. Japanese Yen
  3. British Pound
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: All the above mentioned currencies are included as reserve currencies under IMF. Kindly, note that; after Euro (EUR),Japanese Yen (JPY),British Pound (GBP)andU.S. Dollar (USD), the Chinese renminbi (RMB) had become the fifth currency included in the global \'basket\' of reserve currencies from 1 October 2016.The RMB will account for 10.92% of the value of the \'special drawing right\' (SDR) basket alongside the US dollar, accounting for 41.73%; the euro, accounting for 30.93%; the Japanese yen, accounting for 8.33%; and the British pound, accounting for 8.09%.An international type of monetary reserve currency was created by the International Monetary Fund (IMF)in 1969, which operates as a supplement to the existing reserves of member countries.
